meanings.definition: A part or division of something.
meanings.sent1: The car engine has many subparts that work together to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She carefully assembled all the subparts of the puzzle to complete the picture.
meanings.sent3: The subparts of the sandwich seemed to be having a party inside the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, each tree is like a subpart of the vast green canopy above.
meanings.sent5: The subparts of the necklace sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.sent1: He decided to subparts the project to make it more manageable for the team.
meanings.sent2: The chef will subparts the recipe into clear steps for the cooking class.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to subparts the rabbit into multiple tiny bunnies for the trick.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to subparts the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes subparts the canvas into a beautiful masterpiece.
